DESCRIPTION: Provides food weekly to people in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Living within boundaries: N-21st St.; S-Washington St.; E-Emerson Ave.; W-Rural St.
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours; use the rear entrance to access the pantry.
WHAT TO BRING:
* State-issued photo ID
* Recent business mail, (such as a utility bill)
SERVICE AREA: N-21st St.; S-Washington St.; E-Emerson Ave.; W-Rural St. in the city of Indianapolis in Marion County

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need once per month. Limited service area.
HOURS:
Mon and Thurs 10am-noon and 1pm-3pm ET
Tues 10am-noon; 1pm-3pm; and 6pm-8pm ET
Monthly 2nd Sat 10am-noon ET
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in zip code 46216, 46218, 46219, 46220, 46226, 46235, 46236, 46250, or 46256 
* Not used this pantry within the current month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours to receive food or to donate; use Door 5 to access the pantry.
WHAT TO BRING:
Required at every visit:
 - Photo ID with name and current zip code 
          - OR - 
 - Business mail less than 30 days old, (such as utility bill) showing name and current address

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to persons in need. Limited service area. Also accepts donations for the pantry and other outreach programs.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living within boundaries: N-Railroad tracks south of Washington St.; S-Raymond St.,
   E-White River; W-Holt Rd. 
* Limit one visit per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address (utility bill or official mail within past 30 days)
SERVICE AREA: N-Railroad tracks south of Washington St.; S-Raymond St.,  E-White River; W-Holt Rd. in the city of Indianapolis in Marion County

DESCRIPTION: Provides food and clothing to persons in need. Selections vary based on donations received. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in Marion County
* Not used this pantry within the past 90 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours; intake interview is required of each client.
WHAT TO BRING:
Needed for each visit:
 * Photo ID for client
 * Proof of address (lease, current utility bill, or rent receipt) 
 * Social Security cards for self and each household member

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Toiletries are also generally available. Limited service area.
HOURS:
Mon, Wed, Fri 10am-2pm;  monthly 3rd Sun 12:30pm-2pm ET
*    Except for the month of June: Fri 10am-noon ET
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living within zip codes 46205 or 46208
* Not received assistance from this pantry within the current calendar month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in with bag, box, or basket to carry items; food pantry is located in the basement.
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of address (such as rent receipt, recent utility bill, or official mail)

DESCRIPTION: Provides food for people in need. Limited service area. Clients may be served up to 2 times per month.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in the city of Indianapolis in Marion County
* Limited to 2 visits per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address (utility bill or lease preferred; recent medical bill or other
   official mail accepted)

Program1: OLD BETHEL AND PARTNERS FOOD PANTRY
DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food for persons in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living within boundaries: N-38th St.; S-Troy Ave.; E-County Line (Carroll Rd); W-Emerson Ave.
* Limit of two visits per month with at least seven days between those visits.
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food weekly for persons in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Photo ID

DESCRIPTION: Provides food for persons in need. Limited service area.
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of address; accepts recent utility bill or other business mail
SERVICE AREA: N-Railroad tracks just south of Washington St.; S-Raymond St.; E-White River; W-Tibbs Ave. in the city of Indianapolis in Marion County.

DESCRIPTION: Provides food for persons in need. Limit of one visit every 30 days; limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in Warren Township of Marion County, Sugar Creek Township of Hancock County,
  or Buck Creek Township of Hancock County
* Not used this pantry within the past 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of address (such as photo ID)
SERVICE AREA: Living in Warren Township of Marion County, Sugar Creek Township of Hancock County, or Buck Creek Township of Hancock County

DESCRIPTION: Provides food for persons in need. Before receiving food, clients must attend a brief devotional. Limit of one bag of groceries per visit; two visits per month. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in zip code 46201 or 46203
* Limit two visits per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE:
* Walk in by 9am; (no exceptions). 
* Participate in intake.
* Attend short devotional (required to receive assistance)
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address (recent mail)

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Photo ID

DESCRIPTION: Provides emergency food assistance and toiletries for persons in need. Written referral required; open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: With referral from a church, community center, or other social service agency
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Written referral

DESCRIPTION: Offers food to persons in need. Clients may choose their own food items from available selections. A point system is used to determine the amount of groceries each client may select. Limited service area.
HOURS: Tues and Fri 8am-noon; Thurs 8am-noon and 5pm-7pm; Sat 8am-11am ET
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in Marion County (may consider surrounding areas)
* Age 18 and older (to be the shopper for the household)
* Household income within 165% Federal Poverty Level
   (client certifies by signature)
* Limit one visit per week
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in for interview and data collection. Long wait times are possible. One shopper per household.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address, such as utility bill, official mail, or notarized lease
* Birth certificate for children under 3 years, if receiving baby supplies
* Shopping Card (after first visit)

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to persons in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in Marion County
* With no other resources for food
* Not used this pantry during the past 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; arrive by 1pm or 5pm on Monday; arriving up to 30 minutes early suggested.
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of address (such as driver's license, current mail, or utility bill)

DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in Marion County
* Not used this pantry within past 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk-in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to persons in need. Occasionally has baby food. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living within boundaries: N-10th St., S-Southeastern Blvd., E-Rural St., W-Pine St./I-65/I-70
* Limit 2 visits per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in to use the pantry; enter through glass door on New York Street.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address (such as recent utility bill)
SERVICE AREA: N-10th St., S-Southeastern Blvd., E-Rural St., W-Pine St./I-65/I-70 in the city of Indianapolis in Marion County

DESCRIPTION: Provides a food pantry for area persons in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Living in Marion County
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in (use door Number 1) and sign in. Food pantry is in the basement community room.
WHAT TO BRING: Nothing needed

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to persons in need. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; use the Entrance 10 at the west side of building (facing Covenant Christian High School; please do not park at the high school.)
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of current address such as recent mail (required at each visit)

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area. Accepts donations for the food pantry and other outreach programs.
HOURS:
Pantry: 2nd and 3rd Wed 1pm-2:30pm; 4th Wed (except if last Wed) 1pm-2:30pm; last Wed 11am-1pm ET
Appointment Line: Daily 9am-11pm ET
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in zip code 46260 or 46268
* Limite one visit per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Call for an appointment; leave name, address, and number of people in household. Accepts a limited number of walk-ins, however, people with appointments are served first.
WHAT TO BRING:
* State-issued photo ID
* Proof of address (recent utility bill or official piece of mail)

DESCRIPTION: Offers nonperishable food assistance to persons in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Living in Marion County
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in. Doors close promptly at 1pm or before if food is gone.
WHAT TO BRING:
First Visit:
Photo ID for all adults in the household
Proof of number of children in the household (such as documentation from the child's school)
Proof of address (such as a recent utility bill or lease)
After First Visit: Photo ID
Note: Above documentation not required if client has a written referral from a social service
     agency AND a photo ID.

DESCRIPTION: Offers food each Tuesday to persons in need. Limited service area.
HOURS:
Sign in: Tues 9:30am-10am ET; or sooner if all slots are full 
Distribution: Tues 10:30am-11am ET
ELIGIBILITY: Living in Wayne or Decatur Township in Marion County
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in (Holt Road entrance) to sign in. Limited slots available each week; first come, first served.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Recent piece of mail

DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need. Limited service area.
HOURS:
Monthly 2nd and 4th Wed 6:30pm-8pm ET
   * Except in Feb, monthly 1st and 3rd 6:30pm-8pm ET
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Call to confirm pantry schedule; walk in during pantry hours.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID 
* Proof of address (not required if client has a written referral from social service agency)

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to people in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living within Pike or Washington Township in Marion County
* Not used this pantry within the past 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address (recent utility bill, official mail, or lease agreement)
* If household of 3 or more people: Proof of each household member (Social Security card, birth certificate)
SERVICE AREA: Living in Pike or Washington townships in Marion County

DESCRIPTION: Provides a food pantry for persons in need. Also offers diabetes and blood pressure screening to clients at the Saturday pantry. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; first come, first served. Clients will be asked for their address, phone number, and the names and ages of all persons living in the home.
WHAT TO BRING: Nothing needed

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to persons in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Living within boundaries: N-34th St.; S-Massachusetts Ave.; E-Sherman Dr.; W-Monon Trail/Cornell Ave.
INTAKE PROCEDURE:
* Call ahead for availability
* Complete intake form upon arrival 
* Brief interview with case worker
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address (lease or recent utility bill)
* Social Security numbers for all household members
* Proof of income; if no income, must provide wage printout from WorkOne
SERVICE AREA: N-34th St.; S-Massachusetts Ave.; E-Sherman Dr.; W-Monon Trail in Marion County

DESCRIPTION: Provides food for persons in need. Pantry may be used once every 30 days. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living within boundaries: N-Washington St.; S-Hanna Ave.; E-Emerson Ave.; W-Meridian St.
* Not received help from this pantry within past 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; pantry is located in small white house in the rear parking lot.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Piece of current mail (will accept rent receipt or car registration on first visit)
* Documentation of each child being claimed (birth certificate, Social Security card, etc.)

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to persons in need. Limited service area.
HOURS: Registration: Mon 10am-noon ET; food is distributed at noon
ELIGIBILITY: Living within zip code 46201 or 46218
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in to register in order to receive food assistance; an optional church service begins at 11:30 am before distrubtion.
WHAT TO BRING: State-issued ID with current address

DESCRIPTION: Provides a three-day supply of groceries to persons in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living within boundaries: N-English Ave.; S-Raymond St.; E-Sherman Dr.; W-Shelby St.
* Within income guidelines for food stamps or school lunch program
* Limit one visit per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; use the entrance at the rear of the building.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address (lease agreement, recent utility bill, or recent mail)
* Birth certificates or Social Security cards for everyone in household
* Proof of income (active food stamp card or letter showing children enrolled
   in school lunch program accepted)
* Bring own bags if available.
SERVICE AREA: N-English Ave.; S-Raymond St.; E-Sherman Dr.; W-Shelby St in Marion County

DESCRIPTION: Provides food once every 30 days to persons in need; by appointment. Limited service area.
HOURS:
Office: Vary
Pantry: Typically 2nd or 3rd Sat; by appointment only
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living within boundaries: N-86th St.; S-Washington St.; E-German Church Rd./Sunnyside
   Rd.; W-Keystone Ave. in Marion County
* Ages 18 and older
* One shopper per household
* Have not been served by this pantry within last 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Call for appointment (same-day calls OK) and to confirm pantry will be open
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID (required at every visit)
* Proof of address (recent utility bill, official piece of mail, or notarized lease)
* Birth certificates for all dependents
SERVICE AREA: N-86th St.; S-Washington St.; E-German Church Rd./Sunnyside Rd.; W-Keystone Ave. in Marion County

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to people in need; limit one visit per month. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in zip code 46205, 46208, 46216, 46220, 46226, 46228, 46240, 46250, 46256 or 46260,  in Marion County
* Limit one visit per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; pantry is at back of church.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address (such as a recent mail or utility bill)
* Social Security cards for all in household

DESCRIPTION: Provides food monthly to persons in need. Personal grooming supplies are occasionally available.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Nothing needed

DESCRIPTION: Provides food for persons in need once each month. Limited service area.
HOURS: Monthly last Thurs 1pm-3pm ET; except Nov and Dec 3rd Thurs
ELIGIBILITY: Living within boundaries: N-38th St.; S-Thompson Rd.; E-White River; W-Raceway Rd.
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of address
SERVICE AREA: Living within boundaries: N-38th St.; S-Thompson Rd.; E-White River; W-Raceway Rd. in Marion County

DESCRIPTION: Provides emergency food assistance for persons in need living in select zip codes in southeastern Marion County.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in 46217, 46227, 46237 or 46107 (Beech Grove)
* Low-income persons
* Not served by this pantry within 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID 
* Two additional documents showing current address; accepts utility bill or other business
    mail dated within the last 30 days
* Social Security cards for all members of the household
* Green Card for non-US Citizens

DESCRIPTION: Provides food, clothing, and household items free of charge to persons in need and accepts donations of these items. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
Living in zip code 46227, 46237, 46259, 46107, 46203 (south of Raymond St.), or 46239 (south of
Troy Ave.)
INTAKE PROCEDURE:
For assistance: Walk in; arrive at least 30 minutes before closing time. (Note: Thursday evening
   may be limited to the first 35 clients in line.)
For donations:  Walk in or call to schedule an appointment.
WHAT TO BRING:
First Visit:
  * Photo ID
  * Proof of address dated within last 30 days (utility bill or first class mail with
     name; junk mail and written rent receipts not accepted) 
  * Social Security cards for all household members
Returning clients
  * Photo ID
  * Utility bill dated within last 30 days with current address

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to veterans and military families in need; assistance limited to once every 30 days. Clothing, hygiene items, and small household goods are also available to veterans.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Veterans and/or families of veterans or active duty military
* Limited to one visit every 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours.
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of military service (such as DD214, VA Hospital card, or Dependent of Active Military member ID card)
SERVICE AREA: Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby counties

DESCRIPTION: Offers perishable and nonperishable food to all in need. Items available vary based on donations received. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open; limit one visit per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Nothing needed.

DESCRIPTION: Offers nonperishable food  to persons in need. Limited service area.

* Not used this pantry within the past 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID 
* Proof of address for all adults in the household
* Social Security cards for all members of household
SERVICE AREA: N-Minnesota St.; S-Hanna Ave.; E-Keystone Ave.; W-Meridian St. in the city of Indianapolis in Marion County

DESCRIPTION: Offers a food pantry and clothing closet for persons in need. Clients may also select clothing, shoes, and hygiene items while at the food pantry. Limited service area.
HOURS: Thurs 5pm-6pm ET; limited to first 15 people
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living within zip code 46201
* Limited to one visit per month.
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in. Pantry serves first 15 people only; arrive early for best chance of service.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Recent mail with name and address showing 46201 zip code

DESCRIPTION: Provides food for persons in need. Open service area. All activities are outdoors; please dress for the weather.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Nothing needed

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food and hygiene supplies to persons in need. Clients may visit each week. Limited service area.

INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours; go to back of building.

* Photo ID
* Proof of address (such as recent utility bill)

DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open; limit one visit every 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; use the west entrance.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address (lease or official mail with postmark date less than 60 days old)

DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need. Fresh produce is sometimes available. Limited service area.

* Living in zip code 46202 or 46208
* Limit of one visit every other week
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.

DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food once each month to persons in need. Limited service area.

Program1: THE LORD'S PANTRY AT ANNA'S HOUSE
DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need. Limited service area. Accepts donations for the food pantry and other outreach programs.
HOURS:
Registration: Sat 8:30am-10:30am ET
Food Distribution: Sat 10:30am-noon ET
ELIGIBILITY: Living within boundaries: N-12th St; S-Washington St; E-White River Pkwy; W-Holmes Ave
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in and register.
WHAT TO BRING:
* ID for everyone in the household
* Recent utility bill 
* Recent copy of SNAP or Medicaid award letter, if applicable
* Proof of all children in household, (report card, birth certificate, social security card])

DESCRIPTION: Provides fresh and nonpershiable food once each month to persons in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Living in Marion County
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours.
WHAT TO BRING: Photo ID

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to persons in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID for household members 18 and older
* Proof of address
* Social security numbers for all household members

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to persons in need. Limited service area. The pantry may be used once within a 30-day period.
Provides food and toiletries to persons in need. Service is limited to once every 30 days with a maximum of six visits per year. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in zip codes 46217, 46221, 46227, and 46237 in Marion County 
    or 46142 and 46143 in Johnson County
* Not used this pantry within the past 30 days (maximum of 6 visits per year)
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; serves first 50 people.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Current utility bill or official mail with name and address

DESCRIPTION: Provides five days of food to families in need. Limited service area.

* Living in the following boundaries in Marion County: N- Washington St.; S-County Line Rd.;

  -OR- Northwestern Consolidated School District in Shelby County
  -OR- Beech Grove

WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID (preferably a driver's license or state ID)
* Proof of current address (such as a utility bill less than 30 days old)

DESCRIPTION: Offers a food pantry, open to all in need after attending church service. Selection varies based on donations. Open service area.
HOURS: Church Service: Sun 11:30am ET, (food is provided after the service.)
ELIGIBILITY: Attend Sunday service at this church
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in to attend church service; food is provided after the service.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address (utility bill preferred)

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to persons in need. Limited service area.
HOURS: Fri 9am-noon ET (or before if food is gone)
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in Hendricks County or west of Meridian Street in Marion County
* Limit one visit per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; complete intake form at each visit.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Valid photo ID
* Proof of address (such as recent mail)
* Social security cards or Medicaid cards for everyone in the household

DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food for persons in need. Limited service area.

Pantry: Tues and Thurs 10am-noon ET 
Office: Mon-Fri 10am-4pm ET
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living east of Meridian Street in Marion County
* Not used this pantry within the past 30 days
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Call for availability before visiting pantry.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Valid photo ID
* Proof of address (prefer copy of lease or utility bill)

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Household items are also available including, bedding, towels, small kitchenware, cleaning supplies, hygiene supplies, and toys. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in zip code 46201, 46202, 46203, 46218, or 46222
* Low-income/financial need
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours; food pantry go into the front of the Thrift Storeis outside around the back of the building at Door 5.

* ID for all household members (photo ID for adults; birth certificate, 
   Social Security card, school records accepted for children)
* Proof of current address if different from photo ID (recent mail with name and address)

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food and toiletries to people in need. Open service area.

DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need. Limited service area.

INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
Photo ID  
-OR- Mail with name and current address

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Living in Marion County
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID 
* Bags for food

DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food to people in need. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; pantry entrance and parking are located at the rear of the building.
WHAT TO BRING: Nothing needed

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food as well as clothing (baby through adult sizes) to people in need. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of address

DESCRIPTION: Provides food monthly for persons in need. Limit of one bag per household. Open service area.
HOURS:
Sept through May:
   Monthly 3rd Sat 2pm-3pm ET or before if food is gone.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; complete brief intake at first visit.
WHAT TO BRING: Photo ID

DESCRIPTION: Provides food to persons in need twice weekly. Accepts donations for the food pantry and other outreach programs.
ELIGIBILITY: Persons in need
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours; sign-up begins at 9am ET
WHAT TO BRING: Nothing needed

DESCRIPTION: Offers perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in during pantry hours; complete a short intake form at each visit.
WHAT TO BRING: Nothing needed

DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need. Toiletries and hygiene products are usually available. Open service area.
HOURS:
Phone/Scheduling: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm ET
Pantry: By appointment
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Call to schedule an appointment.
WHAT TO BRING: Photo ID

DESCRIPTION: Provides clothing and nonperishable food to persons in need. Adults' and children's clothing is always available; limited to three bags per household per visit.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Photo ID, if available

DESCRIPTION: Provides food and donated clothing to persons in need. Available items vary based on donations received. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Limit one visit per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE:
* Walk in to receive food and choose clothing.
* To donate food or clothing, drop off during pantry hours
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Birth certificate, social security card, or other form of ID for all members of the household
  (such as birth certificate, social security card, Medicaid card, etc.)

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food monthly to persons in need. Limited service area.
HOURS:
Monthly 2nd and 4th Sat noon-2pm ET (or before if food is gone)
    * Except Nov and Dec 3rd Sat
ELIGIBILITY: Living in Marion County
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; complete a brief intake at first visit and every 6 months thereafter.
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of address (such as photo ID, utility bill, or other business mail)

DESCRIPTION: Offers perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need once per month. Open service area.
HOURS: Monthly 2nd Thurs 1:30pm-3pm ET; (or before if food is gone)
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
Photo ID
Proof of address, (such as recent utility bill)

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. This pantry also offers clients various life-skills classes, including nutrition, cooking, and budgeting. Details are available at the pantry. Limited service area.
HOURS:
Monthly 1st Sat 11am-2pm ET
 * Except July and Aug 2nd Sat
ELIGIBILITY:
Living within boundaries: N-71st St./Westlane Rd.; S-62nd St./Michigan Rd./64th St.;
E-Grandview St.; W-Guion Rd.
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Food Pantry Card (provided at 2nd visit)
SERVICE AREA:
Living within boundaries: N-71st St./Westlane Rd.; S-62nd St./Michigan Rd./64th St.;
   E-Grandview St.; W-Guion Rd. in Marion County

DESCRIPTION: Provides food, hygiene items, and paper products to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limit one visit per month; limited service area.
HOURS: Wed 2pm-6pm; Thurs 3pm-6pm; Fri 10:30am-12:30pm and 2pm-4pm; and monthly 2nd Sat 10am-1pm ET
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in Pike Township of Marion County
  -OR- addresses west of Ditch Rd./Grandview Dr. (in Washington Township of Marion County)
* Limit one visit per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address; (such as recent utility bill or other official mail)

DESCRIPTION: Offers perishable and nonperishable food, personal hygiene items, and cleaning supplies to persons in need. Clients make their own selection from available items and may visit the pantry twice per month. Limited service area.
HOURS: Tues 12:30pm-3pm; Wed 4pm-6:30pm; Thurs and Sat 10am-noon ET
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in Washington Township of Marion County
* Limit of two visits per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID
* Proof of address in the form of a signed lease agreement OR recent business mail

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Sometimes has gently used clothing. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in using west entrance; pantry is in the basement.
WHAT TO BRING: Photo ID (preferred) or proof of address (recent utility bill preferred)

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food monthly to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Living in zip code 46254, 46260, or 46268 in Marion County
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in to Fellowship Hall; (yellow building behind the church.)
WHAT TO BRING:
* Photo ID 
* Proof of address (such as utility bill)

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Open service area.
HOURS: Tues, Wed, and Sat 10am-3pm; Thurs 2pm-7pm ET
ELIGIBILITY: Open; limit one visit per calendar week
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; no delivery available.
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of Indiana address
SERVICE AREA: Hendricks County, Johnson County, Marion County, and Morgan County

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food for persons in need. Toilet paper and bar soap is usually available. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open; not used this pantry within past 30 days; limit six visits per year
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* State-issued photo ID
* Social Security cards for all household members
* Recent business mail with name and address

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY:
* Living in Lawrence Township of Marion County
* Limit one visit per month
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Mail (with name) dated within past 60 days (such as utility bill, bank statement, government mail)

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Living in zip code 46205, 46218, or 462226
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in (no smoking permitted on church property).
WHAT TO BRING: Proof of address (such as recent mail or lease)

DESCRIPTION: Provides food and clothing monthly to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. A warm breakfast is also available during this time. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Open
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in
WHAT TO BRING: Nothing needed

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Living in Marion County
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING: Nothing needed

DESCRIPTION: Provides nonperishable food, baby food, and paper goods to people in need. Clients may make their own selection from available items.  Limited service area.
HOURS:
Pantry: Monthly 4th Sat 9am-11amET
Phone: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm ET
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Call ahead to confirm food is available. (Pantry is the last door at the rear of the church; bring bags for food.)
WHAT TO BRING:
* State-issued photo ID
* Proof of current address

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food and hygiene supplies to Marion County persons in need. Diapers are usually available. Limited service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Living in Marion County
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in.
WHAT TO BRING:
* State-issued photo ID
* Proof of current address

DESCRIPTION: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to seniors, ages 55 and older. Clients make their own selection from available items. Open service area.
ELIGIBILITY: Age 55 or older
INTAKE PROCEDURE: Walk in; bring bags to carry food.
WHAT TO BRING:
* Proof of age
* Proof of address
SERVICE AREA: Hendricks County, Johnson County, Marion County, and Morgan County

Program1: YOU FEED THEM MISSIONAL FOOD PANTRY
